column4: my audio output is in use by some unknown application and i can't play any sounds.. how can i find out what app is using it so that i can terminate it?
sudo lsof /dev/dsp* /dev/audio* /dev/mixer* /dev/seq* /dev/snd/*
all i got was 'mixer_app', which i can't terminate
that's mixer_applet2.
wth
none of those solutions worked ;(
why don't you kill the pids?
even if i kill mixer_applet2, the problem remains
that's weird..
what problem?
problem is audio not playing any sounds on rhythmbox or any other player
what i currently have open: xchat, pidgin, azureus, nautillus and nicotine..
don't know how those could affect any of that
pastebin the output from that sudo lsof command, please, then tell me the url.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/22766/ - there it is, verbatim
please preface statements to me with my nick, thanks!
sorry, my bad
and you made a typo: it's /dev/seq*, not /dev/sed*
sorry.. got the same output, though.. what does that warning mean?
well, first, the warning doesn't matter.  Disregard it.  Second, why are you using OSS devices like /dev/mixer instead of the ALSA ones?
i've always used them and they worked fine.. i assume i would get everything working again if i just rebooted, but i'd rather find out what the problem
start from a clean slate.  Reboot.
then poke me.
